Measure_L4: Entering the country by plane, train, sea, or road
Comment: Who enters Italy, by plane, train, by sea or by road, even in the absence of symptoms, is obliged to immediately communicate their entry into the country to the Department of Prevention of the local health authority. The person is then subjected to health surveillance and fiduciary isolation for 14 days. This is what a decree signed yesterday by the Minister of Health, Roberto Speranza, and by that of Infrastructure and Transport, Paola De Micheli. The measure is valid until March 25 and serves to counter the further spread of the new coronavirus epidemic.

Measure_L2: Increase in medical supplies and equipment
Measure_L4: Prevent and mitigate problems related to the supply of important medicines used to the treatment of patients with Covid-19
Comment: The European Medicines Agency (Ema), in consultation with the pharmaceutical industry and EU member states, has launched an enhanced rapid monitoring system to help prevent and mitigate problems related to the supply of important medicines used to the treatment of patients with Covid-19. Under this system, each pharmaceutical company will appoint a single industry contact point (i-Spoc) which will have the task of reporting to Ema and to the competent national authorities all the current and expected shortcomings of the medicines used for Covid-19 patients, both as regards centrally authorized and nationally authorized medicines

Measure_L4: Practical guide for those who take care of the elderly
Comment: The Higher Institute of Health (ISS) has created and published on its website the booklet "Practical guide for those who take care of the elderly" aimed at providing useful and practical advice, especially to carers. The document specifies a note from the ISS �offers indications on how to protect the elderly by protecting themselves, since taking care of an elderly person means helping him to get up, walk, eat and wash and therefore it is not possible to keep the distance of at least one meter ". In the document, in particular, there is information on the coronavirus, indications on how to assist the elderly when they are at home and when they are away from home, on how to behave if you have the doubt of having contracted the infection, but also on how correctly wear mask and gloves,on how to wash your hands and how to ensure proper home and environment hygiene. The brochure has been translated into 8 languages, English, French, Spanish, Romanian, Polish, Russian, Portuguese and Tamil and will also be made available in the form of a decalogue to be launched on social networks and distributed in a printable version, as a poster, in pharmacies, medical offices, hospitals

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Comment: Recommendations for all users of transport services public: Do not use public transport if you have symptoms of infections acute respiratory (fever, cough, cold) - Purchase, where possible, tickets in electronic format, online or via app - Follow the signs and routes indicated inside the stations or stops always keeping the distance of at least one meter from other people - Use the access doors to the vehicles indicated for the ascent and the descent, always respecting the interpersonal distance of safety of one meter - Sit only in permitted places while keeping the distance from the other occupants - Avoid approaching or asking the driver for information - During the trip, frequently sanitize your hands and avoid touching your face (Annex 9 DPCM 26 April - summary of MIT)

To move safely during Phase 2 of the pandemic in our country, I have followed the recommendations for public transport passengers, the  guidelines contained in Annex 9 of the Prime Minister's Decree of 26 April  and references to circulars (�) You must necessarily wear a mask, also made of fabric, for the protection of the nose and mouth

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Measure_L3: Communication targets protection of vulnerable populations
Measure_L4: Hotline for psychological support during covid-19 crisis
Comment: The Covid-19 emergency is putting a strain on the psychological stability of people dealing with an unprecedented situation in its drama. The fear of contagion, the measures of isolation, as indispensable on a health level as they are difficult on the human level, loneliness, mourning, economic uncertainties: all elements that can give rise to attacks of anxiety, stress, fears, discomfort. For these reasons, the psychological toll-free number 800.833.833 , activated by the Ministry of Health and Civil Protection , will be operational from April 27 , with the technological support offered free of charge by TIM. A number chosen paying tribute to the Law 23 December 1978, number 833, which established the National Health Service. The number will also be reachable from abroad on 02.20228733 and access methods will also be provided for the deaf.

Measure_L4: Give them a role in the protection of workers at workplace
Comment: the Ministry has issued a circular containing operational indications relating to the activities of the competent doctor, drawing attention to this figure during the reopening of the production activities suspended during the pandemic by SARS -COV. If, in fact, the role of the competent doctor is of primary importance in the protection of health and safety at work in the ordinary course of work, it is amplified in the current moment of pandemic emergency, the period during which he goes to confirm the their role as the employer's "global consultant". Read the circular April 29, 2020 - Operational indications relating to the activities of the competent doctor in the context of measures to combat and contain the spread of the SARS-CoV-2 virus in the workplace and in the community
